sen.j: 加納惣三郎（かのう そうざぶろう、生没年不明）は、京都出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Sozaburo KANO (male, unknown to unknown) was from Kyoto and was a member of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: ただし、現存する新選組隊士名簿には存在しない幻の隊士でもある。
sen.e: However, KANO was also a phantom member whose name was not listed in the Shinsengumi member list which still exists today.

sen.j: 京都押小路の木綿問屋越前屋の次男として生まれるが、幼少より武芸を好んで剣術を習い、18歳で新選組に入隊。
sen.e: Though KANO was born as the second son of a merchant whose trade name was Echizen-ya, who dealt with cotton, and whose store was located on Oshi-koji street in Kyoto, KANO liked martial arts since his childhood, learned Japanese fencing, and joined Shinsengumi at the age of 18.

sen.j: その若さと装いの華やかさから「今牛若丸」とあだ名される。
sen.e: KANO was given a nickname, "Ima-Ushiwakamaru" due to his youth and brilliant attire.

Kano was given a nickname, "Ima-Ushiwakamaru" due to his youth and brilliant attire.

sen.j: 局長近藤勇の小姓役、次いで小頭格に昇進した頃、嶋原通いにはまる。
sen.e: KANO was appointed to be a page to the leader, Isami KONDO and, when he was later on promoted to an assistant chief, he was hooked on visiting Shimabara licensed quarters.
KANO was appointed to be a page to the leader, Isami KONDO and, when he was later on promoted to an assistant chief, was hooked on visiting Shimabara licensed quarters.

sen.j: 輪違屋の錦木太夫へ通い詰めて金欠に陥ったため、辻斬り強盗をするようになった。
sen.e: Because KANO visited a lady, Nishiki-dayu in a red-light house, Wachigai-ya very frequently and fell into poverty, he started to commit slaying robbery on the street.
Because KANO visited a lady, Nishiki-dayu in a red-light house, Wachigai-ya very frequently, he fell into poverty, and started to rob and kill people on the street.

sen.j: 新選組より田代某という人物が、密かに加納処分役に任命されたが返り討ちとなる。
sen.e: Though a certain Mr. TASHIRO was secretly assigned a role of getting rid of KANO, TASHIRO was killed by KANO when he attacked KANO.
Though a certain Mr. TASHIRO was secretly assigned the role to get rid of KANO, TASHIRO was killed by KANO when he attacked KANO.
Though a certain Tashiro was secretly assigned the role to get rid of Kano, Tashiro was killed by Kano when he attacked Kano.

sen.j: 加納は島原通いを続けていたが、ある日島原へ向かうため屯所の塀を飛び越えたところ、副長土方歳三らが待ちかまえており、即座に斬殺された。
sen.e: KANO still continued to visit Shimabara licensed quarters and, when KANO jumped over the fence of the stationing facility to visit Shimabara one day, the vice leader, Saizo HIJIKATA and some members ambushed him and immediately killed him.

sen.j: 辻斬り事件を起こしたこともあってか、島原近辺では当時有名な話だったと言う。
sen.e: It is said that this was a famous topic around Shimabara in those days because KANO also committed the slaying robbery on the street.
It is said that this was a famous topic around Shimabara in those days because KANO also committed robberies and killings on the street.

sen.j: 墓所は壬生寺にあったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that KANO's grave was in Ninjo-ji temple.

sen.j: 加納惣三郎は司馬遼太郎の短編「前髪の惣三郎」（『新選組血風録』収録）の主人公で、田代彪蔵と衆道（男色）に陥るストーリーになっている。
sen.e: Sozaburo KANO is the leading character in a short novel, Maegami no Sozaburo (Sozaburo with a Forelock) by Ryotaro SHIBA and, in the novel, he fell in homosexual love with Torazo TASHIRO.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）5月20日の近藤勇の書簡に新選組内で男色が流行していたことが記されており、これに着想を得た創作である。
sen.e: It is written in a letter of Isami KONDO dated May 20, 1864 that homosexual love affairs were prevailing in Shinsengumi and, therefore, the story in the novel is a fiction inspired by this letter.
